info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 3:38PM EDT until April 7 at 11:31AM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky...
South Fork Licking River at Cynthiana affecting Harrison County.
.Heavy rain from the past few days will cause the river to rise.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...South Fork Licking River at Cynthiana.
* WHEN...Until late Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, A large section of city park floods. Water begins to back up in some streets in west side of town. At 22.0 feet, Intersections of Pearl and Locust, Poplar and Penn, and Poplar and Cromwell Alley flood. KY 36 (Pleasant Street) between Locust and W. Pike flood. KY 983 before Infirmary Road floods. At 23.0 feet, Some homes on west side of town flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EDT Friday the stage was 20.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 PM EDT Friday was 20.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 21.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to 17.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will rise above flood stage Sunday morning to 21.8 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall below flood stage again early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.9 feet on 05/04/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Saturday afternoon at 200 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING
